questions.question: Why doesn't Huck get along with Miss Watson or Widow Douglas?

choices.answer: because they want to civilize him
because they stole him away from his pap
they made him paint the fence
they said he could not hang around Tom Sawyer

questions.question: How does Huck feel about prayer?

choices.answer: "don't take no stock" since it don't do no immediate good
doesn't like it, but "I does it to make Miss Watson happy"
never heard of it
does it every night because, "the good Lord says to!"

questions.question: Huck gave all his money to Judge Thatcher; why did he do this?

choices.answer: Pap was coming and he would demand Huck's money to buy booze
he owed the money for a fine he got by breaking a window
he owed the money for a fine he got by breaking a law
because the judge was money advisor

questions.question: How does Huck feel towards Pap?

choices.answer: he feared and didn't like Pap
he loved his dear Pap
Pap is Pap, and Huck is bound to turn out just like him
he never has met Pap

questions.question: What matters more to Huck?

choices.answer: freedom
money
material things
Miss Watson and Widow Douglas

questions.question: What is the MAIN thing Jim and Huck find in the house that floats by them?

choices.answer: a corpse
three robbers
a family trying to get to shore
nothing, just an empty house

they hate each other
they have NOTHING in common

questions.question: Why do Huck and Jim start down the Mississippi River?

choices.answer: people start looking for them on Jackson Island
they want to have an adventure, for grins
they have a raft, why not?
slave hunters told them that was the only way to get away

Jim, the slave
Jim Turner

questions.question: Who did Jim think wasn't very smart for wanting to cut a baby in half?

choices.answer: King Sollermun
Huck
the robbers

questions.question: Why didn't the slave hunters catch Jim after talking to Huck?

choices.answer: Huck said his Pap was very ill
they didn't see him on the raft

questions.question: What bad luck did Huck and Jim have in Chapter 16 (XVI)?

choices.answer: steamboat ran over the raft
a rattlesnake bit them both
Jim broke his ankle, and Huck had to carry him everywhere

questions.question: Why did Twain include the adventure with the Grangerfords?

choices.answer: to show how dumb the feud is, & how foolish people can be
because it's funny
why not?
because it's vital to the story line

questions.question: Why did the townspeople return to the king's and duke's show?

choices.answer: for revenge; they felt they were being taken
the king and duke were good looking
because the newspaper told them they needed to see it twice
they truly loved it

choices.answer: he's a good father, and a compassionate man
he doesn't like children
Huck didn't care about Jim's family
she doesn't like to be told what to do

the closet
the fireplace
the pantry

picture, of the three, Peter always kept in his shirt pocket

questions.question: How do Huck's and Tom's plans, to free Jim, differ from one another?

choices.answer: Huck's is practical; Tom's is VERY involved

they don't differ, both came up with the same plan

questions.question: What do we learn about Tom when we read about the plan to free Jim?

with enough convincing, he'll do anything you want
he values all opinions equally
he doesn't make plans

questions.question: How is Huck superior to Tom?

they take a test and Huck scores a lot higher than Tom

questions.question: What ends up happening to Tom?

choices.answer: goes home with Aunt Polly
Miss Watson adopts him
Huck and he run away
Widow Douglas hires him as a butler

questions.question: Why is Huck for another adventure after Aunt Sally says she wants to adopt him?

choices.answer: because she wants to civilize him
because she says he's no good and needs to do work for her

no reason, the two don't have anything to with one another

questions.question: Being "dead" does what for Huck?
